thread.title: Southern Tier opens on North Shore
thread.title_full: Southern Tier opens on North Shore

author: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Southern Tier opens on North Shore

organizations.name: pittsburgh post-gazette  southern tier brewing company

text:
Southern Tier opens on North Shore January 24, 2017 3:59 PM Post-Gazette Southern Tier manufactures about 30 different types of beer. It will be open for dinner only, from 4 to 10 p.m. today through Thursday, then shift to its normal 11 a.m. to midnight hours on Friday. Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
Southern Tier Brewing Companyâ€™s North Shore brewpub opens for business today. 
The Lakewood, N.Y.-based brewery announced plans in March to open a Pittsburgh location, only their second in the country. 
Southern Tier will occupy a 6,200-square-foot spot on North Shore Drive and plans to brew beer on site, and have a full-service restaurant. Customers also will have access to a 9,800-square-foot patio/beer garden. The location will be the first outside of Lakewood, where the brewery operates two pubs and a gift shop on its campus. 
South Side-based Frank B. Fuhrer Wholesale has been one of Southern Tier's top wholesalers in the country, said Southern Tier brand manager Nathan Arnone. 
"Pittsburgh was one of the first cities to embrace us outside of New York state," Mr. Arnone said last year. 
Southern Tier manufactures about 30 different types of beer. It will be open for dinner only, from 4 to 10 p.m. today through Thursday, then shift to its normal 11 a.m. to midnight hours on Friday.
